head.title: National Briefing | Northeast: New York: Mayors Show Gun-Control Advertisement

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | Northeast: New York: Mayors Show Gun-Control Advertisement
hedline.hl2: New York: Mayors Show Gun-Control Advertisement

block.p: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg of New York and other members of the national coalition Mayors Against Illegal Guns unveiled a 30-second television advertisement intended to pressure Congress to rescind the so-called Tiahrt amendment, a measure attached to spending bills each year since 2003 that bans the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives from releasing gun-trace data, except to police officials and prosecutors working on a particular crime. The advertisement is to be broadcast in Washington, D.C., as well as in the districts of two members of a House subcommittee that is weighing the measure, Representatives Rodney Frelinghuysen, Republican of New Jersey and the ranking minority member, and Alan B. Mollohan, Democrat of West Virginia and the panel chairman. The advertisement will also be broadcast in the district of Representative Todd Tiahrt, the Kansas Republican who wrote the amendment. Mr. Bloomberg also announced the addition of 27 New Jersey mayors to the group, bringing the total to 214.
